name: Northern Ireland
legal_system: Separate Northern Ireland legal system under Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006

notice_procedures: Notice to Quit + County Court possession

notice_to_quit.name: Notice to Quit
notice_to_quit.minimum_period: 28 days (periodic), or until end of fixed term

rent_arrears.evidence: Rent account, arrears calculation, payment history

breach_of_tenancy.description: Breach of terms of tenancy agreement

antisocial_behavior.description: Tenant or occupier engaging in antisocial behavior
antisocial_behavior.evidence: Witness statements, police reports, council reports

landlord_requires_possession.description: Landlord requires property for own occupation or sale
landlord_requires_possession.notice_required: 28 days Notice to Quit (periodic) or end of fixed term

suitable_alternative_accommodation.evidence: Details of alternative accommodation, suitability assessment

court_system.jurisdiction: 11 County Court divisions across Northern Ireland
process: Enforcement by Enforcement of Judgments Office

deposit_protection.scheme: Tenancy Deposit Scheme Northern Ireland (TDS NI)
deposit_protection.cap: No statutory cap but must be reasonable (typically 1 month's rent)

mandatory_hmo.trigger: Property occupied by 3+ persons from 2+ households
mandatory_hmo.certificate: HMO certificate required from NIHE (Northern Ireland Housing Executive)

hmo_licensing.penalty: Criminal offence to operate HMO without certificate

rent_controls.regulated_tenancies: Some legacy tenancies have rent controls

eviction_ban.illegal_eviction: Criminal offence under Protection from Eviction (NI) Order 1981

notice_to_quit.minimum_period: 28 days (periodic) or until end of fixed term
requirements: Contain prescribed information about tenant rights

from_england_wales: Shorter deposit protection deadline (14 days vs 30)
No Section 8/21 notices (uses Notice to Quit)
from_scotland: No rent caps or pressure zones
No penalties for misuse of grounds
